page.title: 14M90 By-pass Relieves Perth.
page.content: With{two trunk roads}in our area, the {A90}from the south and{A9}from the west, the{completion}of the southern half of the{Western by-pass M90, linking both, should have eased some of the{traffic chaos}in{Perth.}Not so, as during the{tourist season}most north-bound visitors must pass through the town. It can be chaotic especially at week ends. { This October,}however, the{final {phase}of the western by-pass will be completed. It will link the M90 south of Perth with the A9 northbound. At Broxden interchange there is a link-up with the A9 for west bound traffic. A mile or so further on a slip road will lead on to the road to Crieff. This was only built as the result of public pressure on the Scottish Secretary of State.
